t: The End of the Wicked and the Peace of the Godly
To the Chief Musician. A Contemplation of David when Doeg the Edomite went and told Saul, and said to him, “David has gone to the house of Ahimelech.”
Why*pn do you boast in evil, O mighty man? The*ld goodness of God endures*i continually.
Your*ld tongue devises destruction, Like*ld a sharp razor, working deceitfully.
You*ld love evil more than good, Lying*ld rather than speaking righteousness. Selah*ipg
You*ld love all devouring words, You*ild deceitful tongue.
God*ln shall likewise destroy you forever; He*ld shall take you away, and pluck you out of your*i dwelling place, And*ld uproot you from the land of the living. Selah*ipg
The*ld righteous also shall see and fear, And*ld shall laugh at him, saying,*i
“Here*ld is the man who*i did not make God his strength, But*ld trusted in the abundance of his riches, And*ild strengthened himself in his wickedness.”
But*ln I am*i like a green olive tree in the house of God; I*ld trust in the mercy of God forever and ever.
I*ld will praise You forever, Because*ld You have done it;*i And*ld in the presence of Your saints I*ld will wait on Your name, for it*i is good.
